comments:
Build: I-20030326

I encountered the NPE below in JDT UI code when I was testing classpath 
containers.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Fresh workspace.
2. Go to Plug-in Development->Java Build Path Control preference page, and 
check the 'use classpath containers' checkbox.
3. Create a Hello, World plug-in project.
4. Go to Plug-in Development->Target Platform preference page.  Choose 
the 'another compatible application' and browse for a WSADIE build.  Reload and 
sselect all plugins.   Press OK.
5. In the package explorer view.  Expand the Hello, World project to see 
the 'Required plug-in entries' container.  Expand it.  Now 
expand 'resources.jar'.  Try to open any .class file in this jar, you will get 
the NPE below.
Error Thu Mar 27 13:30:20 EST 2003 Problems occurred when invoking code from 
plug-in: "org.eclipse.ui.workbench".
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)

Bug can be reproduce using 200303261556. WSAD is not needed to repoduce. It is 
enough to point the target platform preference page to a eclipse installation.

This will be a readme item for 2.1. Adapting severity and priority.

There are the following work arounds:

1) Expand the class file in the Packages Explorer. The outline presents the 
same information to the user as the editor that would open if the problem 
would not exists. 

2) Attach source to the related JAR file following these steps:
a) Select the project
b) Open Project>Properties.
c) In the Properties dialog select the Java Build Path node.
d) Flip to the Libraries page
e) Expand the "Required plug-in entries" container
f) Expand the node of the related JAR file
g) Select the Source Attachment node
h) Press Edit...
i) Enter the corresponding source zip in the presented dialog
j) Acknowledge everything with OK
*** Bug 35970 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=4984)
patch for ClassFileEditor
